section.title: Overview
section.para: This module provides a report of the way &kamailioname; configuration has been executed as part of a unit test for different SIP scenarios.
In order to identify different scenarios a prefix string should be used inside the Call-ID header.

section.title: &kamailio; Modules
section.para:
The following modules must be loaded before this module:
pv.

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &kamailio; with this module loaded:
None.

section.title: basedir (string)
section.para: Control where the config reports should be stored. The dir must exist and &kamailioname; must have permissions to write on it.

itemizedlist.para: mask - Control the type of vars it should display in the report:

example.title: Set mask parameter
example.programlisting: ... # dump xavp(8) and avp(4) vars modparam("cfgt", "mask", 12) ...

section.title: callid_prefix (string)
section.para: Prefix used to identify test scenario messages. Last char of the string will be used as delimiter for the scenario ID. With parameter set to NGCP% and Call-ID NGCP%123%456 the scenario identified will be 123.

para.emphasis: Default value is NGCP% (using % as delimiter).

section.title: Usage
section.para: This module is used by the debugger module, so it must be loaded first. To enable the generation of the reports, the debugger module must be configured by setting the cfgtest parameter to "1".
section.programlisting:
... #!ifdef WITH_DEBUG loadmodule "cfgt.so" loadmodule "debugger.so" #!endif ... #!ifdef WITH_DEBUG # ----- cfgt params ----- modparam("cfgt", "basedir", "/tmp/kamailio/cfgtest") modparam("cfgt", "callid_prefix", "TRACE-ID%") modparam("cfgt", "mask", 32)
# ----- debugger params ----- modparam("debugger", "cfgtrace", 1) modparam("debugger", "log_level_name", "exec")
modparam("debugger", "cfgtest", 1) #!endif ...

section.title: Report format
section.para: cfgt generates a json file per request processed. The files are created at <basedir>/<prefix>/<message_id>.json. The message_id is a sequence starting with 1 per scenario defined by prefix module parameter.
The json report has three top members, flow, sip_in and sip_out describing, the flow of the configuration routes, the SIP message processed and the SIP messages sent during that process execution.
The flow of the configuration routes is defined by an array of routes with the content of the variables controled by mask module parameter.
Each routename has a prefix as start|, return|, when the route finish its execution and exit| or drop| if the route finish its execution with exit or drop.
